 PREV PACKAGE   NEXT PACKAGE FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Package com.baypackets.ase.sbb

Interface Summary
B2bSessionController The back-to-back session controller interface (B2bSessionController) defines an object that is used to establish and control a back-to-back user agent session.
CallTransferController This is an interface which extends SBB interface
CDR The Call Detail Record interface.
ConferenceController This interface defines an object that is used to establish a conference call and control the signalling involved in adding and removing participants, terminating the call, and performing various advanced conferencing features including sidebar conferences and dialogs.
ConferenceInfo The Conference Info interface defines the attributes used for identifying the conference.
ConferenceParticipant  
ConferenceRegistry Conference Registry interface can be used to find the conference controller using the conference id.
EarlyMediaCallback The Early Media Callback interface.
MediaServer The MediaServer interface provides the details of a Media Server including its ID, Name, Status, Host, Port and capabilities.
MediaServerSelector The MediaServerSelector interface defines the APIs for selecting the media servers during runtime, based on the media server capabilities, name, etc.
MessageFilter The MessageFilter interface provides a callback to an SBB object so that it can perform various manipulations to SIP messages before the SBB sends them to the network.
MsOperationResult The MsOperationResult interface defines an object that encapsulates the results of an RTP interaction between a media server and network endpoint.
MsSessionController The MsSessionController interface defines an object that initiates and manages the interactions between a media server and network endpoint.
SBB The SBB (Service Building Block) interface is implemented by all service building blocks.
SBBCallback The SBB Callback interface.
SBBEventListener The SBBEventListener interface defines the callback mechanism for the SBBs to communicate with the application to notify the status or outcome of the action requested by the application.
TbctController The TBCT controller interface TbctController defines an object that is used to connect an existing call leg to an address (both terminating on same gateway) using TBCT.
 

Class Summary
DefaultConferenceRegistry Default Conference Registry provides the default implementation of the Conference Registry Interface.
MsCollectSpec The MsCollectSpec class defines the Media Server's DTMF Collect Operation specification.
MsConferenceSpec  
MsPlaySpec The MsPlaySpec class defines the specification for a media server Play operation.
MsRecordSpec The MsRecordSpec class defines the Media Server's Recording Operation specification.
MsVarAnnouncement The MsVarAnnouncement class provides the accessor and mutator methods for defining the attributes of a variable announcement.
SBBEvent The SBBEvent class defines events generated by the SBBs to indicate the completion or failure of a specific task or operation that the application has requested from the SBB.
SBBFactory The SBBFactory class provides a factory for obtaining service building block objects.
 

Exception Summary
CDRWriteFailedException The CDRWriteFailedException is thrown when the Write operation on the CDR fails.
ConnectException This ConnectException is thrown by various SBB interface methods if an error occurs while connecting an endpoint.
DisconnectException The DisconnectException is thrown by the various SBB interface methods if an error occurs while disconnecting an endpoint.
MediaServerException The MediaServerException is thrown by the MediaServer interface methods if an error occurs while interacting with the media server.
ProcessMessageException The ProcessMessageException is thrown by the SBB if an error occurs while processing a given SIP message.
SBBFactoryException The SBBFactoryException is thrown by the SBBFactory methods.
